Testing API¶

To use the testing section, you should be in the same directory as manage.py :

Kiu-tomas-nardibackend → then run:

python manage.py test kiu_flights.test_flights

In the PowerShell console, you should see a message like this:

Each dot represents a unit test
.....

Found 5 test(s).
Creating test database for alias 'default'...
System check identified no issues (0 silenced).

Ran 5 tests in 0.670s

OK
Destroying test database for alias 'default'...

Also, if you want to see the full test cases, you should go to:

  • backend/kiu_flights/test_flights → Testing Endpoint.

class kiu_flights.test_flights.SearchFlightsTestCase(methodName='runTest')¶

Bases: APITestCase

Test for the search_flights API endpoint.

This class tests various scenarios for the flight search view:

Objectives:

  • Parámetros obligatorios: Los 3 parámetros (date, from, to) deben estar presentes.

  • Formato de fecha: Debe ser YYYY-MM-DD.

  • Códigos de ciudad: Deben ser exactamente 3 letras mayúsculas.

  • Filtrado: Solo mostrar vuelos que coincidan exactamente con los parámetros, sino devolver [].

The tests use a temporary JSON file located in flight_data/flight.json.

classmethod setUpTestData()¶

Set up test data for all test methods.

Creates a temporary JSON file with sample flights: - NYC → LAX flight on 2025-09-15 - NYC → SFO flight on 2025-09-15

test_flights_found()¶

Test that the endpoint returns 200 and a list of matching flights when flights match the query parameters.

test_invalid_city_code()¶

Test that the endpoint returns 400 if city codes are invalid (not 3 uppercase letters).

test_invalid_date_format()¶

Test that the endpoint returns 400 if the date format is invalid (not YYYY-MM-DD).

test_missing_parameters()¶

Test that the endpoint returns 400 if any query parameter is missing.

test_no_flights_found()¶

Test that the endpoint returns 200 and an empty list if no flights match the query parameters.
